Director Davies then explained new Department of Health guidance, outlining health and safety protocols including daily health screenings and a new Qualtrics digital attestation platform. Chief Jessee detailed the in-person learning plans, which involve cohort bubbles of a maximum of 15 students and physically distanced classrooms. Grades 2-12 will continue remote learning due to staffing limitations and the inability to maintain cohort bubbles for secondary students. Juneau also announced all school employees are eligible for the COVID-19 vaccine (Phase 1B or earlier) through a partnership, and addressed previous questions regarding nursing staff, COVID-19 case protocols, and remote learning classroom structures for grades 2-5.

Chief Jessee further addressed physical spaces, explaining all 70 campuses underwent inspections focusing on air circulation and student capacity, alongside detailed cleaning protocols for common spaces and classrooms. Director Nicholson clarified the district would adhere to DOH guidelines regarding vaccine impact on transmission and confirmed PPE provision. Director Davies also noted the anticipated increase in kindergarten enrollment for the 2021-22 school year. Chief Jessee highlighted the importance of dedicating time for staff and students to build relationships, integrating this via email/video conferencing and over 30 social-emotional learning lessons per grade. A staff well-being campaign promotes colleague check-ins and offers group counseling. The town hall concluded, announcing future virtual town halls, with the next on Jan 26th, covering outdoor and community education updates ahead of March 1st in-person instruction.

timeline.title: Welcome and Initial In-Person Learning Plans
timeline.note: Superintendent Juneau welcomes attendees and introduces district leaders, discussing plans for returning Pre-K, K, 1st grade, and intensive special education students to school buildings by March 1st.

timeline.title: Survey Responses and Planning
timeline.note: 70% of families and 80% of staff responded to the intent-to-return survey, crucial for finalizing schedules and staffing ratios.

timeline.title: Vaccine Eligibility for School Employees
timeline.note: All school employees are now eligible for COVID-19 vaccine in Phase 1B or earlier, with a new partnership for access.

timeline.title: Addressing Previous Questions
timeline.note: Superintendent Juneau answers questions about funding for nurses, COVID-19 case protocols, and 2nd-5th grade remote learning classroom reassignments.

timeline.title: Survey Outreach & Appeal Process
timeline.note: School leaders are contacting families who haven't responded to the return-to-school survey, and an appeal process for changes will be available.

timeline.title: Health & Safety Protocols
timeline.note: Director Davies discusses updated Department of Health guidance, daily health screenings, and the new Qualtrics digital attestation platform.

timeline.title: Detailed In-Person & Remote Learning Plans
timeline.note: Chief Jessee outlines in-person services for Pre-K, K, 1st grade, and special education with cohort bubbles; grades 2-12 remain remote due to staffing/cohort limitations.

timeline.title: Physical Space, Cleaning, & PPE
timeline.note: Chief Jessee details campus inspections for air flow, student capacity, portable classroom use, cleaning schedules, and PPE provision for staff.

timeline.title: Future Kindergarten Enrollment & Initial Relationship Building
timeline.note: Director Davies notes anticipated increase in next year's kindergarten enrollment, and Chief Jessee emphasizes time for building staff-student relationships.

timeline.title: Expanded Relationship Building & Social-Emotional Support
timeline.note: Further discussion on integrating time for staff-student relationships, and provision of over 30 social-emotional learning lessons per grade.

timeline.title: Staff Well-being Initiatives
timeline.note: Superintendent Juneau's campaign encouraging staff to connect for well-being, and availability of group counseling opportunities.

timeline.title: Next Virtual Town Hall Announced
timeline.note: Announcement of the January 26th town hall on outdoor and community education updates, preceding March 1st in-person instruction.
